fields.authentication_method: Authentication method for the Token Endpoint
fields.enable_custom_validation_for_this_attrib: Enable custom validation for this attribute?
fields.id_token_encrypted_response_alg: JWE alg Algorithm for encrypting the ID Token
fields.id_token_encrypted_response_enc: JWE enc Algorithm for encrypting the ID Token
fields.id_token_signed_response_alg: JWS alg Algorithm for signing the ID Token
fields.name: Name
fields.request_object_encryption_alg: JWE alg Algorithm for encrypting request objects
fields.request_object_encryption_enc: JWE enc Algorithm for encrypting request objects
fields.request_object_signing_alg: JWS enc Algorithm for signing request objects
fields.servers: server details separated by comma, e.g. 'server1:8080,server2:8081'
fields.token_endpoint_auth_method: JWS alg Algoritm for Authentication method to token Endpoint
fields.run_introspection_script_before_accessto: Run Introspection Script Before AccessToken As Jwt Creation And Include Claims
fields.user_info_encrypted_response_alg: JWE alg Algorithm for encrypting userinfo responses
fields.user_info_encrypted_response_enc: JWE enc Algorithm for encrypting userinfo responses
fields.user_info_signed_response_alg: JWS alg Algorithm for signing userinfo responses

messages.action_commit_question: Audit log: Want to apply changes made on this page?
messages.action_deletion_question: Do you really want to delete this item?
messages.alert_couchbase: Backing data source is not Couchbase !
messages.resource_not_found_message: The requested resource doesn't exist on this server. Please contact the site administrator or the support team.

placeholders.action_commit_message: Provide the reason of this change
placeholders.enable_ssl_communication: Enable SSL communication between auth Server and LDAP server
placeholders.ldap_bind_max_connections: Enter the ldap Bind Max Connections
placeholders.name: Enter the name
placeholders.post_logout_redirect_uris: Enter a post redirect URI in format (e.g. https:// or schema://)
placeholders.redirect_uris: Enter a redirect URI in format (e.g. https:// or schema://
placeholders.typeahead_holder_message: Enter multiple items by selecting from appeared dropdown after entering each item.

json_properties.accessTokenLifetime: Specifies the Client-specific access token expiration.
json_properties.allowPostLogoutRedirectWithoutValidation: Allows post logout redirect without validation for End Session Endpoint.
json_properties.authenticationFiltersEnabled: Boolean value specifying whether to enable user authentication filters.
json_properties.authorizationCodeLifetime: The lifetime of the Authorization Code.
json_properties.authorizationEndpoint: The URL of the Authorization Endpoint.
json_properties.backchannelAuthenticationResponseExpires: Back channel Authentication Response Expires In.
json_properties.backchannelTokenDeliveryModesSupported: Back channel Token Delivery Modes Supported.
json_properties.backchannelUserCodeParameterSupported: Back channel User Code Parameter Supported.
json_properties.changeSessionIdOnAuthentication: Boolean value specifying whether change session_id </br> on authentication. Default value is true.
json_properties.checkSessionIFrame: URL of an OP iframe that supports cross-origin communications for </br>session state information with the RP Client, using the HTML5 postMessage API.
json_properties.cibaGrantLifeExtraTimeSec: Specifies the CIBA Grant life extra time in seconds.
json_properties.cibaMaxExpirationTimeAllowedSec: Specifies the CIBA token expiration time in seconds.
json_properties.claimTypesSupported: A list of the Claim Types that the OpenID Provider supports.
json_properties.claimsLocalesSupported: Languages and scripts supported for values in Claims being returned.
json_properties.claimsParameterSupported: Specifies whether the OP supports use of the claims parameter.
json_properties.cleanServiceBatchChunkSize: Each clean up iteration fetches chunk of expired </br>data per base dn and removes it from storage.
json_properties.cleanServiceInterval: Time interval for the Clean Service in seconds.
json_properties.clientAuthenticationFiltersEnabled: Boolean value specifying whether to enable client authentication filters.
json_properties.clientBlackList: Black List for Client Redirection URIs.
json_properties.clientInfoEndpoint: The URL of the Client Info Endpoint.
json_properties.clientRegDefaultToCodeFlowWithRefresh: Boolean value specifying whether to add Authorization Code Flow </br>with Refresh grant during client registration.
json_properties.clientWhiteList: White List for Client Redirection URIs.
json_properties.configurationUpdateInterval: The interval for configuration update in seconds.
json_properties.consentGatheringScriptBackwardCompatibil: Boolean value specifying whether turn on Consent Gathering Script</br> backward compatibility mode. If true AS will pick up script with higher level globally. </br>If false (default) AS will pick up script based on client configuration.
json_properties.customHeadersWithAuthorizationResponse: Boolean value specifying whether to enable Custom </br>Response Header parameter to return custom headers with the Authorization Response.
json_properties.dcrAuthorizationWithClientCredentials: Boolean value indicating if DCR authorization to be performed using client credentials.
json_properties.dcrSignatureValidationEnabled: Boolean value enables DCR signature validation. Default is false.
json_properties.dcrSkipSignatureValidation: Boolean value indicating if signature validation is to be skipped.
json_properties.defaultSignatureAlgorithm: The default signature algorithm to sign ID Tokens.
json_properties.defaultSubjectType: Default Subject Type used for Dynamic Client Registration.
json_properties.deviceAuthzRequestExpiresIn: Expiration time given for device authorization requests.
json_properties.deviceAuthzResponseTypeToProcessAuthz: Response type used to process device authz requests.
json_properties.deviceAuthzTokenPollInterval: Default interval returned to the client to process device token requests.
json_properties.disableJdkLogger: Boolean value specifying whether to enable JDK Loggers.
json_properties.displayValuesSupported: A list of the display parameter values that the OpenID Provider supports.
json_properties.dynamicGrantTypeDefault: A list of the OAuth 2.0 Grant Type values that it's possible to </br>set via client registration API.
json_properties.dynamicRegistrationExpirationTime: Expiration time in seconds for clients created with </br>dynamic registration, -1 means never expire.
json_properties.dynamicRegistrationPasswordGrantTypeEnab: Boolean value specifying whether to enable </br>Password Grant Type during Dynamic Registration.
json_properties.dynamicRegistrationPersistClientAuthoriz: Boolean value specifying whether to persist client authorizations.
json_properties.dynamicRegistrationScopesParamEnabled: Boolean value specifying whether to enable </br>scopes parameter in dynamic registration.
json_properties.enableClientGrantTypeUpdate: Boolean value to specify if client can update Grant Type values.
json_properties.endSessionEndpoint: URL at the OP to which an RP can perform a redirect </br>to request that the End-User be logged out at the OP.
json_properties.endSessionWithAccessToken: Accept access token to call end_session endpoint.
json_properties.errorHandlingMethod: A list of possible error handling methods.
json_properties.errorReasonEnabled: Boolean value specifying whether to return detailed </br>reason of the error from AS. Default value is false.
json_properties.expirationNotificatorEnabled: Boolean value specifying whether expiration </br>notificator is enabled (used to identify expiration for persistence that </br>support TTL, like Couchbase). Default value is true
json_properties.expirationNotificatorIntervalInSeconds: The expiration notificator interval in seconds.
json_properties.expirationNotificatorMapSizeLimit: The expiration notificator maximum size limit.
json_properties.fapiCompatibility: Boolean value specifying whether turn on FAPI </br>compatibility mode. If true AS behaves in more strict mode
json_properties.forceIdTokenHintPrecense: Boolean value specifying whether force id_token_hint </br>parameter precense (false by default)
json_properties.forceOfflineAccessScopeToEnableRefreshTo: Boolean value specifying whether force offline_access </br>scope to enable refresh_token grant type. Default value is true.
json_properties.frontChannelLogoutSessionSupported: Boolean value to specify support for front channel logout session.
json_properties.grantTypesSupported: A list of the OAuth 2.0 Grant Type values that this OP supports.
json_properties.idGenerationEndpoint: URL for the ID Generation Endpoint.
json_properties.idTokenEncryptionAlgValuesSupported: A list of the JWE encryption algorithms (alg values) supported by the OP </br>for the ID Token to encode the Claims in a JWT.
json_properties.idTokenEncryptionEncValuesSupported: A list of the JWE encryption algorithms (enc values) supported by the OP for </br>the ID Token to encode the Claims in a JWT.
json_properties.idTokenLifetime: The lifetime of the ID Token.
json_properties.idTokenSigningAlgValuesSupported: A list of the JWS signing algorithms (alg values) </br>supported by the OP for the ID Token to encode the Claims in a JWT.
json_properties.idTokenTokenBindingCnfValuesSupported: Array containing a list of the JWT Confirmation </br>Method member names supported by the OP for Token Binding of ID Tokens. </br>The presence of this parameter indicates that the OpenID Provider supports Token Binding of ID Tokens.</br> If omitted, the default is that the OpenID Provider does not support Token Binding of ID Tokens.
json_properties.introspectionAccessTokenMustHaveUmaProte: Reject introspection requests if access_token in Authorization </br>header does not have uma_protection scope.
json_properties.introspectionResponseScopesBackwardCompa: When false, introspection endpoint returns scopes as a space-separated string, otherwise as JSON array.
json_properties.introspectionScriptBackwardCompatibility: Boolean value specifying whether switch off client's introspection scripts (true value) </br>and run all scripts that exists on server. Default value is false.
json_properties.invalidateSessionCookiesAfterAuthorizati: Boolean value to specify whether to invalidate `session_id` and `consent_session_id` </br>cookies right after successful or unsuccessful authorization.
json_properties.issuer: URL using the https scheme with no query or fragment component </br> that the OP asserts as its Issuer Identifier.
json_properties.jwksAlgorithmsSupported: A list of algorithms that will be used in JWKS endpoint.
json_properties.jwksUri: URL of the OP's JSON Web Key Set (JWK) document. This contains the signing key(s) the RP uses to validate signatures from the OP.
json_properties.keepAuthenticatorAttributesOnAcrChange: Boolean value specifying whether to keep authenticator attributes on ACR change.
json_properties.keyRegenerationEnabled: Boolean value specifying whether to regenerate keys.
json_properties.keyRegenerationInterval: The interval for key regeneration in hours.
json_properties.keySignWithSameKeyButDiffAlg: Specifies if signing to be done with same key but apply different algorithms.
json_properties.keyStoreSecret: The password of the Key Store.
json_properties.logClientIdOnClientAuthentication: Boolean value to specify if application should log the Client ID on client authentication
json_properties.logClientNameOnClientAuthentication: Boolean value to specify if application should log the Client Name on client authentication.
json_properties.loggingLayout: Logging layout used for oxAuth loggers.
json_properties.metricReporterInterval: The interval for metric reporter in seconds.
json_properties.metricReporterKeepDataDays: The days to keep metric reported data.
json_properties.opPolicyUri: URL that the OpenID Provider provides to the person </br>registering the Client to read about the OP's requirements </br>on how the Relying Party can use the data provided by the OP.
json_properties.opTosUri: URL that the OpenID Provider provides to the person registering the Client to read about OpenID Provider's terms of service.
json_properties.openIdConfigurationEndpoint: URL for the Open ID Connect Configuration Endpoint.
json_properties.openidScopeBackwardCompatibility: Set to false to only allow token endpoint request for </br>openid scope with grant type equals to authorization_code, </br>restrict access to userinfo to scope openid </br>and only return id_token if scope contains openid.
json_properties.openidSubAttribute: LDAP attribute used for the sub claim.
json_properties.oxElevenDeleteKeyEndpoint: URL for the oxEleven Delete Key Endpoint.
json_properties.oxElevenGenerateKeyEndpoint: URL for the oxEleven Generate Key Endpoint.
json_properties.oxElevenSignEndpoint: URL for the oxEleven Sign Endpoint.
json_properties.oxElevenVerifySignatureEndpoint: URL for the oxEleven Verify Signature Endpoint.
json_properties.oxElevenJwksEndpoint: URL for the oxEleven JWKS Endpoint.
json_properties.oxId: URL for the Inum generator Service.
json_properties.pairwiseCalculationKey: Key to calculate algorithmic pairwise IDs.
json_properties.pairwiseCalculationSalt: Salt to calculate algorithmic pairwise IDs.
json_properties.persistIdTokenInLdap: Specifies whether to persist id_token into LDAP (otherwise saves into cache).
json_properties.persistRefreshTokenInLdap: Specifies whether to persist refresh_token into LDAP (otherwise saves into cache).
json_properties.personCustomObjectClassList: LDAP custom object class list for dynamic person enrollment.
json_properties.refreshTokenExtendLifetimeOnRotation: Boolean value specifying whether to extend refresh token lifetime on rotation.
json_properties.refreshTokenLifetime: The lifetime of the Refresh Token.
json_properties.rejectJwtWithNoneAlg: Boolean value specifying whether reject JWT requested or validated with algorithm None. Default value is true.
json_properties.removeRefreshTokensForClientOnLogout: Boolean value specifying whether to remove refresh tokens on logout. Default value is true.
json_properties.requestObjectEncryptionAlgValuesSupporte: A list of the JWE encryption algorithms (alg values) supported by the OP for Request Objects.
json_properties.requestObjectEncryptionEncValuesSupporte: A list of the JWE encryption algorithms (enc values) supported by the OP for Request Objects.
json_properties.requestObjectSigningAlgValuesSupported: A list of the JWS signing algorithms (alg values) supported by the OP for Request Objects.
json_properties.requestParameterSupported: Boolean value specifying whether the OP supports use of the request parameter.
json_properties.requestUriHashVerificationEnabled: Boolean value specifying whether the OP supports use of the request_uri hash verification.
json_properties.requestUriParameterSupported: Boolean value specifying whether the OP supports use of the request_uri parameter.
json_properties.requireRequestUriRegistration: Boolean value specifying whether the OP requires any request_uri values used to be </br>pre-registered using the request_uris registration parameter.
json_properties.responseModesSupported: A list of the OAuth 2.0 Response Mode values that this OP supports.
json_properties.responseTypesSupported: A list of the OAuth 2.0 response_type values that this OP supports.
json_properties.returnClientSecretOnRead: Boolean value specifying whether a client_secret is returned on client GET or PUT. </br>Set to false by default which means to not return secret.
json_properties.sectorIdentifierCacheLifetimeInMinutes: Lifetime of sector identifier redirect uri's cache.
json_properties.serverSessionIdLifetime: The sessionId lifetime in seconds for sessionId. By default same as sessionIdLifetime.
json_properties.serviceDocumentation: URL of a page containing human-readable information that developers might want or need to know when using the OpenID Provider.
json_properties.sessionAsJwt: Experimental feature. Do not use in production!
json_properties.sessionIdEnabled: Boolean value specifying whether to enable authentication by session_id.
json_properties.sessionIdLifetime: The lifetime of session id in seconds. If 0 or -1 then expiration is not set. </br>`session_id` cookie expires when browser session ends.
json_properties.sessionIdPersistInCache: Boolean value specifying whether to persist session_id in cache.
json_properties.sessionIdPersistOnPromptNone: Boolean value specifying whether to persist session ID on prompt none.
json_properties.sessionIdRequestParameterEnabled: Boolean value specifying whether to enable session_id HTTP request parameter.
json_properties.sessionIdUnauthenticatedUnusedLifetime: The lifetime for unused unauthenticated session states.
json_properties.sessionIdUnusedLifetime: The lifetime for unused session states.
json_properties.shareSubjectIdBetweenClientsWithSameSect: Share Subject ID between clients with same Sector ID.
json_properties.skipAuthorizationForOpenIdScopeAndPairwi: If a client has only openid scope and pairwise id, person should not have to authorize.
json_properties.skipRefreshTokenDuringRefreshing: Boolean value specifying whether to skip refreshing tokens on refreshing.
json_properties.softwareStatementValidationType: Specifies validation type for software statement during Dynamic Client Registration. </br>`script` - validate with help of Dynamic Client Registration custom script, </br>`jwks_uri` - validate by JWKS fetched by uri where jwks_uri is specified as claim of software statement by name defined in softwareStatementValidationClaimName. </br>`jwks` - validate by JWKS which are taken from sofware statement claims. </br>Not recommended. Claim name specified by softwareStatementValidationClaimName. </br>`none` - validation of software statement is skipped.
json_properties.spontaneousScopeLifetime: The lifetime of spontaneous scope in seconds.
json_properties.statTimerIntervalInSeconds: Interval in seconds which specifies how often statistic timer should run.
json_properties.statWebServiceIntervalLimitInSeconds: Interval in seconds which specifies limit before statistic web service can handle next call. </br>Protection from calling expensive service too often.
json_properties.subjectTypesSupported: A list of the Subject Identifier types that this OP supports. Valid types include pairwise and public.
json_properties.tokenEndpoint: The URL of the Token Endpoint.
json_properties.tokenEndpointAuthMethodsSupported: A list of Client Authentication methods supported by this Token Endpoint.
json_properties.tokenEndpointAuthSigningAlgValuesSupport: A list of the JWS signing algorithms (alg values) supported by the Token Endpoint for the signature </br>on the JWT used to authenticate the Client at the Token Endpoint for the </br>private_key_jwt and client_secret_jwt authentication methods.
json_properties.tokenRevocationEndpoint: The URL of the Token (access_token or refresh_token) Revocation Endpoint.
json_properties.trustedClientEnabled: Boolean value specifying whether a client is trusted and no authorization is required.
json_properties.uiLocalesSupported: Languages and scripts supported for the user interface.
json_properties.umaAddScopesAutomatically: Add UMA scopes automatically if it is not registered yet
json_properties.umaConfigurationEndpoint: URL for the UMA Configuration Endpoint.
json_properties.umaGrantAccessIfNoPolicies: Specify whether to grant access to resources if there is </br>no any policies associated with scopes.
json_properties.umaRestrictResourceToAssociatedClient: Restrict access to resource by associated client.
json_properties.umaRptAsJwt: Issue RPT as JWT or as random string.
json_properties.umaValidateClaimToken: Validate claim_token as id_token assuming it is issued by local idp.
json_properties.updateClientAccessTime: Boolean value to specify if application should update </br>oxLastAccessTime/oxLastLogonTime attributes on client authentication.
json_properties.updateUserLastLogonTime: Boolean value to specify if application should update </br>oxLastLogonTime attribute on user authentication.
json_properties.useLocalCache: Boolean value specifying whether to enable local in-memory cache for </br>attributes, scopes, clients and organization configuration.
json_properties.userInfoEncryptionAlgValuesSupported: A list of the JWE encryption algorithms (alg values) JWA supported </br>by the UserInfo Endpoint to encode the Claims in a JWT.
json_properties.userInfoEncryptionEncValuesSupported: A list of the JWE encryption algorithms (enc values) JWA supported </br>by the UserInfo Endpoint to encode the Claims in a JWT.
json_properties.userInfoEndpoint: The URL of the User Info Endpoint.
json_properties.userInfoSigningAlgValuesSupported: A list of the JWS signing algorithms (alg values) JWA supported by </br>the UserInfo Endpoint to encode the Claims in a JWT.
json_properties.corsEnabled: Boolean value indicating if the filter is enabled.
json_properties.corsAllowedOrigins: A list of origins that are allowed to access the resource. A * can be specified to enable access to resource from any origin. Otherwise, a whitelist of comma separated origins can be provided.
json_properties.corsAllowedMethods: A comma separated list of HTTP methods that can be used to access the resource, using cross-origin requests. These are the methods which will also be included as part of Access-Control-Allow-Methods header in pre-flight response.
json_properties.corsAllowedHeaders: The names of the supported author request headers.
json_properties.corsSupportCredentials: A flag that indicates whether the resource supports user credentials. This flag is exposed as part of Access-Control-Allow-Credentials header in a pre-flight response. It helps browser determine whether or not an actual request can be made using credentials.
json_properties.corsLoggingEnabled: Value to enable logging, Setting the value to False will disable logging.
json_properties.corsPreflightMaxAge: The duration in seconds the browser is allowed to cache the result of the pre-flight request.
json_properties.corsRequestDecorate: A flag to control if CORS specific attributes should be added to the HttpServletRequest object.
json_properties.attemptExpiration: How long store in cache information about particular login attempt. It's needed to count login attempts withing specified period of time.
json_properties.maximumAllowedAttemptsWithoutDelay: How many attempts application allow without delay.
json_properties.delayTime: Delay time in seconds after reaching maximumAllowedAttemptsWithoutDelay limit.
json_properties.bruteForceProtectionEnabled: Enable or disable service, This functionality can be enabled dynamically.

openid_client.description: A clear  and precise description of the client
openid_client.logoUri: URL that references a logo for the Client application
openid_client.idTokenTokenBindingCnf: Specifies the JWT Confirmation Method member name (e.g. tbh) </br>that the Relying Party expects when receiving Token Bound ID Tokens. </br>The presence of this parameter indicates that the Relying Party supports Token Binding</br> of ID Tokens. If omitted, the default is that the Relying Party </br>does not support Token Binding of ID Tokens.
openid_client.clientUri: URL of the home page of the Client. The value of this field must point to a valid Web page.
openid_client.policyUri: URL that the Relying Party Client provides to the End-User to read about the how the profile data will be used.
openid_client.tosUri: URL that the Relying Party Client provides to the End-User to read about the Relying Party's terms of service.
openid_client.jwksUri: URL for the Client''s JSON Web Key Set (JWK) document containing key(s) that are used for signing requests to the OP. The JWK Set may also contain the Client''s encryption keys(s) that are used by the OP to encrypt the responses to the Client. When both signing and encryption keys are made available, a use (Key Use) parameter value is required for all keys in the document to indicate each key''s intended usage.
openid_client.jwks: List of JSON Web Key (JWK) - A JSON object that represents a cryptographic key. The members of the object represent properties of the key, including its value.
openid_client.sectorIdentifierUri: URL using the https scheme to be used in calculating Pseudonymous Identifiers by the OP.
openid_client.subjectType: Subject type requested for the Client ID. Valid types include pairwise and public.
openid_client.idTokenSignedResponseAlg: JWS alg algorithm (JWA) required for signing the ID Token issued to this Client.
openid_client.idTokenEncryptedResponseAlg: JWE alg algorithm (JWA) required for encrypting the ID Token issued to this Client.
openid_client.idTokenEncryptedResponseEnc: JWE enc algorithm (JWA) required for encrypting the ID Token issued to this Client.
openid_client.userInfoSignedResponseAlg: JWS alg algorithm (JWA) required for signing UserInfo Responses.
openid_client.userInfoEncryptedResponseAlg: JWE alg algorithm (JWA) required for encrypting UserInfo Responses.
openid_client.userInfoEncryptedResponseEnc: JWE enc algorithm (JWA) required for encrypting UserInfo Responses.
openid_client.requestObjectSigningAlg: JWS alg algorithm (JWA) that must be used for signing Request Objects sent to the OP.
openid_client.requestObjectEncryptionAlg: JWE alg algorithm (JWA) the RP is declaring that it may use for encrypting Request Objects sent to the OP.
openid_client.requestObjectEncryptionEnc: JWE enc algorithm (JWA) the RP is declaring that it may use for encrypting Request Objects sent to the OP.
openid_client.tokenEndpointAuthMethod: Requested Client Authentication method for the Token Endpoint.
openid_client.tokenEndpointAuthSigningAlg: JWS alg algorithm (JWA) that must be used for signing the JWT used to authenticate the Client at the Token Endpoint for the private_key_jwt and client_secret_jwt authentication methods.
openid_client.defaultMaxAge: Specifies the Default Maximum Authentication Age.
openid_client.requireAuthTime: Boolean value specifying whether the auth_time Claim in the ID Token is required. It is required when the value is true.
openid_client.defaultAcrValues: Array of default requested Authentication Context Class Reference values that the Authorization Server must use for processing requests from the Client.
openid_client.initiateLoginUri: Specifies the URI using the https scheme that the authorization server can call to initiate a login at the client.
openid_client.postLogoutRedirectUris: Provide the URLs supplied by the RP to request that the user be redirected to this location after a logout has been performed.
openid_client.requestUris: Provide a list of requests_uri values that are pre-registered by the Client for use at the Authorization Server.
openid_client.scopes: Provide list of scopes granted to the client.
openid_client.claims: Provide list of claims granted to the client.
openid_client.trustedClient: Attribute which corresponds to the pre-Authorization property. Default value is false.
openid_client.lastAccessTime: Integer timestamp, measured in the number of seconds since January 1 1970 UTC, indicating last access time.
openid_client.lastLogonTime: Integer timestamp, measured in the number of seconds since January 1 1970 UTC, indicating last login time.
openid_client.persistClientAuthorizations: Specifies if the client authorization details are to be persisted. Default value is true.
openid_client.includeClaimsInIdToken: If true then claims are included in token id, default value is false.
openid_client.refreshTokenLifetime: Specifies the Client-specific refresh token expiration.
openid_client.accessTokenLifetime: Specifies the Client-specific access token expiration.
openid_client.rptAsJwt: Specifies whether RPT should be return as signed JWT.
openid_client.accessTokenAsJwt: Specifies whether access token as signed JWT.
openid_client.accessTokenSigningAlg: Specifies signing algorithm that has to be used during JWT signing. If it''s not specified, then the default OP signing algorithm will be used.
openid_client.softwareId: pecifies a unique identifier string (UUID) assigned by the client developer or software publisher used by registration endpoints to identify the client software to be dynamically registered.
openid_client.softwareVersion: Specifies a version identifier string for the client software identified by 'software_id'. The value of the 'software_version' should change on any update to the client software identified by the same 'software_id'.
openid_client.softwareStatement: Specifies a software statement containing client metadata values about the client software as claims. This is a string value containing the entire signed JWT.
openid_client.backchannelTokenDeliveryMode: specifies how backchannel token will be delivered.
openid_client.backchannelClientNotificationEndpoint: Client Initiated Backchannel Authentication (CIBA) enables a Client to initiate the authentication of an end-user by means of out-of-band mechanisms. Upon receipt of the notification, the Client makes a request to the token endpoint to obtain the tokens.
openid_client.backchannelAuthenticationRequestSigningA: The JWS algorithm alg value that the Client will use for signing authentication request, as described in Section 7.1.1. of OAuth 2.0 [RFC6749]. When omitted, the Client will not send signed authentication requests.
openid_client.backchannelUserCodeParameter: Boolean value specifying whether the Client supports the user_code parameter. If omitted, the default value is false.
openid_client.expirationDate: Integer timestamp, measured in the number of seconds since January 1 1970 UTC, indicating when this permission will expire
openid_client.tlsClientAuthSubjectDn: The tls Client Auth Subject Dn
openid_client.grantTypes: The list of grant types for this client
openid_client.responseTypes: The list of responses types for this client
openid_client.redirectUris: The list of redirect uri for this client
openid_client.runIntrospectionScriptBeforeAccessTokenA: Run Introspection Script Before AccessToken As Jwt Creation And Include Claims

scope.displayName: A human-readable name of the scope.
scope.description: A human-readable string describing the scope.
scope.scopeType: The scopes type associated with Access Tokens determine what resources will.
scope.claims: Claim attributes associated with the scope.
scope.defaultScope: Boolean value to specify is the scope is default.
scope.showInConfigurationEndpoint: Show this scope In Configuration Endpoint
scope.dynamicScopeScripts: Dynamic Scope Scripts associated with the scope.
scope.umaType: Specifies if the scope is of type UMA.
scope.id: Based Url encode unique id for the scope
